thread.title: Hulk: Oscar left Chelsea for Shanghai because of me

title: Hulk: Oscar left Chelsea for Shanghai because of me
text:
0 Jan 10, 2017 9:38:46 AM The Brazil international striker reveals that he helped to sell his Selecao team-mate on the Chinese Super League side before his big-money move 
Shanghai SIPG star Hulk says that he helped to convince Oscar to quit Chelsea to move to the Chinese Super League. 
Why a 48-team World Cup is a good thing 
The 25-year-old signed for Andre Villas-Boas's side after a bid of €60 million (£52.1m) was accepted by the Premier League leaders in December. 
Oscar, who scored on his debut in a 2-1 friendly win over Al Batin, signed a contract that will reportedly see him earn €460,000 a week but Hulk says that it was his glowing praise of life in China that ultimately convinced his compatriot to move. 
"I talked to Oscar about Shanghai SIPG before he made the move," he told assembled Chinese media in Doha. "I said to him that Shanghai is a beautiful city, the club is fantastic and we will get even better in the coming years. 
"I also said our team-mates are very friendly and welcoming, which makes me feel pretty good. After hearing what I told him, he came." 
Hulk was signed from Zenit in June for a reported €55.8m (£48.5m) fee, which was a record for Asian football at the time. 
OFFICIAL: Cohen Bramall joins Arsenal 
But the Brazil international denied that price tags will put any extra pressure on himself, Oscar or fellow forward Elkeson to perform. 
"We have grown accustomed to playing under huge pressure, no matter how much the club has spent on players," said the 30-year-old. "Oscar, Elkeson and I are used to it. This is not a problem. 
"Each new player is coming to help the team and I believe Oscar will help us a lot. The level of the team has improved a lot, obviously, and I think we will win the title next season." Related
